pullRequest.title: feat: DHIS2-8839 - New dataItems endpoint
pullRequest.bodyText:
Hi @larshelge / @luciano-fiandesio, this is the initial implementation of this endpoint. Please take a look and let me know what you think.
Thanks
@vilkg => could, please, you review the new e2e tests I added? The files are:
https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-core/pull/5661/files#diff-756d9664004c2e118e1a9f3bd03ac446
https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-core/pull/5661/files#diff-a2a13efcb6e54d4a500817b0085b3c50
https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-core/pull/5661/files#diff-139b1029db844345914f89afb4537e7a
Thanks!

feat: Draft impl for the new /dataItems endpoint [DHIS2-8839]

This a draft implementation that still needs to be tested, improved and test covered.

Pagination was also fixed and now it's not allowed for multiple dimension items (2.35)

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-core into DHIS2-8839
fix: Code review fixes [DHIS2-8839]

nodes.bodyText: Just a consideration: do we need to fail the entire request if one of the entity is not readable?
minor: you can use generics here: Comparator<BaseDimensionalItemObject>

very minory:
BeanComparator<>
NullComparator<>
to remove the generics warning

very minor:
new ComparatorChain<>()
to remove the warning

feat: Adding e2e tests [DHIS2-8839]

nodes.bodyText:
for the sake of reporting, I would use rest-assured assertions here. For example:
response.validate().body("nameableObjects.dimensionItemType", hasSize(greaterOrEqualTo(1))). If you do so, upon failure the response will be printed out and the assertion message will look more meaningful than only "expected true, but found false"
Do you import this data item before the tests? We run them on empty db.

I would validate that every item in nameableObjects array is equal to theDimensionType here.
For example: response.validate().body( "nameableObjects.dimensionItemType", everyItem(is( theDimensionType ) ));
Are you sure that this one will always be first item returned? You could do "nameableObjects.code", contains('...')
you could use anyInvalidDimensionType var here instead of INVALID_TYPE
I would propose to change the contract from nameableObjects to dataItems, to make it consistent with other APIs

commit.message: fix: Fixing e2e tests per code review [DHIS2-8839]
chore: Adding missing javadoc [DHIS2-8839]

nodes.bodyText: Just wondering, where is this class RestApiActions? Is it part of this PR or already existing?
